title: Mapper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT)
Interview Descriptions: Super chill and easy. I arrived and was immediately met. The people were great and it was a comfortable situation. Missoula is a beautiful city and an awesome place to live.
Interview Questions: Explain your skill set and answer technical questions

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: A group of 5 people including a student representative zoomed with me for the interview. They asked a series of 7 questions with followup on my experiences as a designer, teacher, and team member. Very kind and authentic group of people. They were honest about the schools lack of diversity and expressed their desire to grow the perspective in their department. The experience was clear and concise.
Interview Questions: How do you measure growth in students' work?

title: Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a video call. It took about an hour. The interview is given by three faculty members with a short discussion of your resume, interest in the field as well as which faculty members you want to work with.
Interview Questions: What was an experiment that made me most passionate about science?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana
Interview Descriptions: Short interview discussing how to build a community as well as some what if scenarios.  There was also questions about how to balance your work and school life and safe boundaries to set.
Interview Questions: How do you build a community

title: Undergraduate Recruitment Student Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my customer service experience, my interest in the position, my love for University of Montana, and my school schedule. The roles and responsibilities were clarified to me.
Interview Questions: What was my school schedule like?

title: UM IT TEC Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a single interview which was about an hour, and I was given an offer within 2 days of the interview. The questions asked were split about half and half between questions about the position and questions about myself. Overall the interview was very conversational.
Interview Questions: How to you react when you don’t know the answer to a situation.

title: Schwanke Honors Institute Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and open environment. I felt very prepared and they asked questions mainly about my experience at school since it was a position for students. It was quick and simple.
Interview Questions: Q: How have you been involved at the University of Montana?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved speaking of ways to build a community as well as developing ideas for programs.  Dressing professionally and being open and excited about the position will take you a long way.
Interview Questions: How will you build a community?

title: Mathematics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor was brilliant, kind, personable, and conscientious. My interview was not one which triggered anxiety or nervousness.  My first contact with the supervisor was a discussion after the University of Montana graduation ceremony.
Interview Questions: What mathematics courses have you completed?

title: Office Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview at all. I asked if there were any work study positions and I got the job just 3 days later. Filled out a very simple application through the university. The only questions I got were if I knew how to use Excel and what my hours of availability were to work. Pretty darn easy overall.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Montana
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online using the University of Montana hiring application process. Onces I appied, the HR personell called me and asked if I was interested in an interview. I was scheduled for an interview by the end of the week. Once arriving on campus for the semester, I was offered the positon and start emmediatly. The training process was easy.
Interview Questions: What is your customer service experience?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Do you fit the team! This interview process was mainly an assessment of personality and skills to see if you are a good fit for the team of interns that you will work with over the next year.
Interview Questions: What organizations are you involved with that correlate with this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and formidable. You are in direct contact with the people who hire you. And you aren't getting some type of phone call from some director in an entirely different city. The questions pertain to your personality.
Interview Questions: Literally none they ask about you about your major and how you can improve the world.

title: Alumni Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Dec 2011
Interview Questions: They weren't very difficult. "Are you personable and outgoing?"

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied, was interviewed 2 weeks later, and hired 2 days after interview.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Montana in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Asked to take the position of Instructor of a native language which was introducted for the first time on campus as a credited course.
Interview Questions: A unexpected question for me was would I be willing to work for very little on a contract base with no garentees of job security.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: We discussed my potential employment/admission through email and telephone conversations prior to me stopping by to meet up.  During this meeting, we discussed the potential work to be done and my background experience.  I asked several questions about the potential for me to work on different aspects of the research, which were answered positively.  The people who work here are dedicated and knowledgeable, as well as friendly.
Interview Questions: How well do you fit in to all this?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Montana (Missoula, MT) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application through the Human Resources office and received a phone call from the supervisor of the position inviting me for an interview. The interview lasted about an hour, and consisted of a range of questions, many of them generic "canned" interview questions that did little to allow me to demonstrate my experience and skills relevant to the position. If I had been the person conducting the interviews, I would have wanted to know more about how the candidates would address typical job duties and responsibilities. I didn't feel that the interview gave me a good chance to demonstrate my strengths, yet I still received an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to work with someone you didn't like.
